EXECUTIVE SUMMARY



The following Risk Management Plan has been prepared for the Wholesome Harvest Bakery facility located at 1955 Blue Hills Road NE in Roanoke, Virginia.  This facility is a commercial bakery, which operates two ammonia systems to cool bread products prior to distribution and chill glycol for cooling mixing equipment.  This program has been prepared pursuant to Part 68, Subpart G of Title 40 of the Code of Federal Regulations.



The system contains approximately 49,000 pounds of ammonia.  The maximum quantity of ammonia contained on site is approximately 49,000 pounds.



A. Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response Policies



To prevent the accidental release of ammonia, Wholesome Harvest has developed the following: 



-     Maintenance procedures to ensure that equipment is properly maintained and functioning properly.

-    Operating procedures to ensure that equipment is operated in a manner that minimizes the possibility of an ammonia release.

-     Employee training to ensure that operators know how to properly use the equipment and non-operators are aware of the dangers of ammonia and the necessary steps to take in the event of an ammonia release.



The Standard Operating Procedure Program is contained in Binder 4: Standard Operating Procedures. Individual SOPs are contained within separate binders.



The general emergency response policy for the site when ammonia is released is to evacuate to an area upwind of the release and notify the appropriate personnel and authorities.  Trained personnel will then assess whether to evacuate the facility, and determine the appropriate level of response.  A copy of the Emergency Action Plan for Wholesome Harvest can be found in Binder 12.  





B. Stationary Source and Substance Handled



As explained above, Wholesome Harvest operates two ammonia cooling systems to cool and/or freeze bread products prior to shipment, and to chill glycol for onsite material mixing. 



In order to reduce the

distance to the endpoint from an accidental release, the following administrative controls and mitigation measures are in place at Wholesome Harvest:



-     Regular maintenance on the equipment.

-     Daily inspections of equipment.

-     Computer monitoring system.



Details regarding the offsite consequence analysis for the worst case and alternative release scenarios can be found in Sections 2 and 3 of this document.



 

C. General Accidental Release Prevention Program Components and Substance Specific Prevention Steps



The following components are contained in the following sections of this Risk Management Plan document:



-     Registration

-     Offsite Consequence Analysis

-     Five-year Accident History

-     Program Specific Component

-     Emergency Response 



In order to further mitigate the effects of an ammonia release, the following risk management components are in place:



-     Maintenance and standard operating procedures for the ammonia systems.

-     Emergency Response Plan.

-     Training for employees.

-     Incident investigation documentation and procedures.

-     Automatic system shutdowns.

-     Windsocks for direction of wind visible on property.



The facility has an accident release prevention program that complies with Occupational Safety and Health Act's Process Safety Management Standard and EPA's Risk Management Program Rule. The prevention program consists of the following elements:



-    Employee Participation Program

-    Process Safety Information

-    Process Hazard Analysis

-    Operating Procedures

-    Training Program

-    Contractor Safety Program

-    Pre-Startup Safety Review Procedures

-    Mechanical Integrity Program

-    Hot Work Permit Procedures

-    Management of Change Procedures

-    Incident Investigation Procedures

-    Compliance Audit Procedures



D. Five-year Accident History



Wholesome Harvest has had no incidents in the past five years from the ammonia system that meet the criteria set forth in 40 CFR, Section 68.42.



E. Emergency Action Pla

n Components



The Emergency Action Plan (EAP) for the Wholesome Harvest facility has been prepared (see Binder 12) and contains information for responding to an ammonia release.  The general emergency response policy for the site when ammonia is released is to evacuate to an area upwind of the release and notify the appropriate personnel and authorities.  Trained personnel will then assess whether to evacuate the facility, and determine the appropriate level of response.



F. Planned Changes to Improve Safety



The following recommendations have been made to improve safety at the facility:



-    Completed Ammonia Operator 1 Training

-    Hired an additional experienced technician.

-    Conducting weekly PSM meetings

-    Complete Process Hazard Analysis, Mechanical Integrity Audit, and Compliance Audit findings and recommendations.
